note.p: Education: St Paul's School; Whitgift School (1876-1881); BA (1889) Trinity College, Cambridge
Career: Lecturer in Mathematics (1889); Director General of Indian Observatories (1904-1924); Professor of Meteorology, Imperial College of Science and Technology (1924)
Obituaries: Biographical Memoirs of Fellows of the Royal Society 1962 vol 8 pp 167-174, plate, by G I Taylor

References: R Singh and F Riess, 'The nobel laureate Sir Chandrasekhara Venkata Raman FRS and his contacts with the British Scientific community in a social and political context' in NR 2004 vol 58 pp 47-64
